data.title: Preview cache html
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.2 - OS Version: Windows7 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Write a html file with bootstrap
Panel Heading Suppression des pièces jointes 2. Preview with shortcut Ctrl+Shift+V 3. Display correctly 4. Modify the text of the link button 5. Should display the new text on a new preview command but stay the same 6. Preview another file 7. Come back to the previous one and the change shows..

data.title: Continue further adoption of ITextModelResolverService

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
We should get rid of `StringEditorInput` in favour of the `ResourceEditorInput`, such that we benefit from the reference counting. There is also files and untitled which are totally bypassing resolver service

1. Adopt resource URIs for all inputs in our Code
  - [x] Debug
  - [x] Output
  - [x] Git
  - [x] Keybindings
  - [x] DiffEditorInput
  - [x] SaveErrorHandler
  - [x] FileEditorInput
  - [ ] UntitledEditorInput

2. Make all code (mainly workbench Editors) go through the `ITextModelResolverService` in one of two ways:
  - Have `Input.resolve` return `IReference<EditorModel>`
  - Replace `input.resolve` calls with `ITextModelResolverService.createReference` calls

data.title: Customize peek
data.body:
It's more of a feature request. I am referring to the peek display zone (the one on blue background).
It's quite a great thing, but it's annoying that uses all the horizontal space. 
In my case I like to use the right side where there is a lot of empty space (no code) to display something. And keep the code from the current file visible and unchanged (when peek is used it shifts the code a few lines lower.  
It would be great if we could change its size and even position anywhere. That way we can see both the peek version and the current file however we like.

data.title: HTML language server throws exception when initialization options are empty
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
Version 1.7.2
Commit 7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f
Date 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z
Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Fedora 25

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use this request to initialize HTML language server
```json
{
  "id": "1",
  "method": "initialize",
  "params": {
    "rootPath": "/home/wywrzal/development/ZEND/Che/runtime-IDE/Test",
    "capabilities": {},
    "clientName": "Eclipse Platform"
  },
  "jsonrpc": "2.0"
}
```
2. As an response error will be returned:
```json
{
  "id": "1",
  "error": {
    "code": -32603,
    "message": "Request initialize failed with message: Cannot read property \u0027embeddedLanguages\u0027 of undefined"
  },
  "jsonrpc": "2.0"
}
```
Isn't a big problem but it would be nice to handle this simple case without exception.

Shell 1.3.8
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0

Since the first time I installed the vscode till now (so it isn't only just recent), this feature never worked for me. It always showed an empty list. I thought that it was a cpptool problem but they never responded.
Can anyone help me with it? Do I need to configure something !?

Thank you.

data.title: Sometimes opening a file I see a full quick diff decoration over the entire file
data.body: Often when I open a file for the first time in a session, I see the quick diff decoration over the entire file and it quickly hides right after. This was not the case before we moved this out to be an extension.

data.title: Allow disabling built in extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0-insider

We have requests to support disabling all TS functionality. Instead of introducing a setting we should allow disabling built in extensions.

data.title: File model loads file on disk even if a backup exists
data.body: This is unnecessary because if we have a backup to restore, we can ignore the contents on disk.

data.title: Allow to Undock Editor Panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

In Visual Studio it is possible to drag a window out of the main application to drop it on the second screen. In Visual Code I have to open a second instance and than I can drop it (but in the first window the file stays open). 

It would be nice, if the behaviour is the same as in Visual Studio.

data.title: Titlebar-less view for Windows
data.body:
A concept based on @flagello’s [Essence](https://github.com/flagello/Essence)

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/240091/21091794/7edfeb5c-c083-11e6-8542-86710ea63fbe.png)
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/240091/21092185/d6dc5992-c085-11e6-8776-62dbdac43989.png)

Key idea:

 - Use the “Great VS Button” to call out the main menu.
 - The title-bar-like zone is used for tabs/editor panel titles.

data.title: Extensions: double-click should open new extension window pinned
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Extensions view
2. Double-click on any extension in the list
3. Click on any other extension in the list

Expected: First extenstion window was pinned and the new extension window was opened after step 3.
Actual: Same window is used for all the extensions.

data.title: In-project search and in-file search should have different highlighting colors
data.body:
Repro steps:
1. Open in-project search (ctrl+shift+f) and search for a letter 'a'
2. Open any text file and search (ctrl+f) for a letter 'b' in it

Expected: i can distinguish 2 search results
Actual: both search results are highlighted with the same color.

Screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4397796/21080425/431618d2-bfaf-11e6-8154-c1d0dd9d03c0.png)

data.title: Unable to perform this action because the process is running.
data.body:
## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output: 1.0.0-preview2-1-003177
VS Code version:1.7.2
OS: OSX 10.12.1
C# Extension version: 1.5.3
mono version :4.8.0

1.When i debug C# program , is throw a Error:
```
Loaded '/usr/local/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App/1.1.0/System.IO.FileSystem.Primitives.dll'. Cannot find or open the symbol file.
Loaded '/usr/local/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App/1.1.0/System.Runtime.Handles.dll'. Cannot find or open the symbol file.
Loaded '/usr/local/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App/1.1.0/System.Text.Encoding.dll'. Cannot find or open the symbol file.
Loaded '/usr/local/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App/1.1.0/System.Text.Encoding.Extensions.dll'. Cannot find or open the symbol file.
Loaded '/usr/local/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App/1.1.0/System.Threading.Tasks.dll'. Cannot find or open the symbol file.

Unable to perform this action because the process is running.
```
2.stop debug, then throw another error:
`The program '/Users/Mecil9/Homework/hwapp/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/hwapp.dll' has exited with code 0 (0x00000000).
`

my launch.json file:
```
`{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (console)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/hwapp.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "externalConsole": false
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (web)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/Debug/netcoreapp1.1/hwapp.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "launchBrowser": {
                "enabled": true,
                "args": "${auto-detect-url}",
                "windows": {
                    "command": "cmd.exe",
                    "args": "/C start ${auto-detect-url}"
                },
                "osx": {
                    "command": "open"
                },
                "linux": {
                    "command": "xdg-open"
                }
            },
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
            },
            "sourceFileMap": {
                "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/Views"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Attach",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.pickProcess}"
        }
    ]
}
````

go to Visual studio and Terminal is OK!
